sources.name: CAL FIRE Fire Hazard Severity Zones
sources.maintainer: California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection

sources.name: ESRI Living Atlas - US Census ACS
sources.notes: American Community Survey 5-year estimates. Auto-updates annually when Census releases new data (typically December).

layers.name: Parcels (Public Assessment Data)
layers.description: Property parcels with assessment data including APN, acreage, assessed values, building characteristics, use codes, and district information. Primary layer for property research.
userQuestions: What's the APN for this address?
How big is this property?
What's the assessed value?
When was this house built?
How many bedrooms does this property have?
Is this property under Williamson Act?
layers.notes: Assessed value differs from market value due to Prop 13 limits. Tax maps are authoritative source for boundary discrepancies.

layers.name: Address Points
layers.description: Point locations for all addresses in Solano County. Used for geocoding addresses to coordinates and linking to parcels via APN.
userQuestions: What are the coordinates for this address?
What's the APN for this address?
Is this address valid?
layers.notes: Multiple address points can share the same APN (multi-unit buildings).

layers.name: City Boundaries
layers.description: Boundaries of all seven incorporated cities in Solano County. Used to determine if a location is in city limits or unincorporated county area.
userQuestions: Is this address in city limits?
Which city is this property in?
Is this location in unincorporated county?
layers.notes: Returns no feature if location is in unincorporated area. Cities: Benicia, Dixon, Fairfield, Rio Vista, Suisun City, Vacaville, Vallejo.

layers.name: County Boundary
layers.description: Solano County external boundary polygon.
userQuestions: Is this location in Solano County?

layers.name: Solano County Zoning
layers.description: Zoning designations for unincorporated Solano County. Does NOT include areas within city limits - use city-specific zoning layers for incorporated areas.
userQuestions: What's the zoning for this property?
Can I build a house here?
Is this agricultural land?
What can I do with this property?
layers.notes: Returns empty for addresses within city limits. Check city boundary first, then use appropriate city zoning layer.

layers.name: Solano County General Plan
layers.description: General Plan land use designations for unincorporated Solano County (2008 plan with updates). Shows long-term land use vision.
userQuestions: What's the General Plan designation?
What's the long-term land use plan for this area?
layers.notes: Returns 'INC' for incorporated (city) areas. Updated September 2023.

layers.name: Board of Supervisors Districts
layers.description: Solano County Board of Supervisors district boundaries (2021 redistricting).
userQuestions: Who is my supervisor?
What district am I in?
How do I contact my county representative?

layers.name: Fire Hazard Severity Zone (Solano Local)
layers.description: Current local Fire Hazard Severity Zone designations for Solano County, maintained by County GIS.
userQuestions: Is this property in a fire hazard zone?
What fire safety requirements apply here?
Do I need defensible space?
layers.notes: Urban areas typically have no FHSZ designation.

layers.name: Fire Hazard Severity Zone - Phase 2 (2025)
layers.description: Upcoming 2025 Fire Hazard Severity Zone reclassifications (Phase 2 update).
userQuestions: Will my fire hazard zone change in 2025?
What are the upcoming fire zone changes?
layers.notes: Shows proposed 2025 reclassifications. Not yet in effect.

layers.name: FEMA Flood Hazard Zones
layers.description: National Flood Hazard Layer (NFHL) flood zone designations. Used for insurance requirements and disclosure.
userQuestions: Is this property in a flood zone?
Do I need flood insurance?
What's the flood risk here?
What is the base flood elevation?

fields.name: FLD_ZONE
fields.description: Zone code (A, AE, AH, AO, V, VE, X)

layers.dataSource: Federal Emergency Management Agency
layers.notes: Zones A/AE/AH/AO/V/VE = SFHA (high risk). Zone X = minimal risk. No feature typically means Zone X.

layers.name: CAL FIRE FHSZ - State Responsibility Area
layers.description: Fire Hazard Severity Zones in State Responsibility Areas (rural/wildland areas where CAL FIRE has primary responsibility).
userQuestions: Is this in a State Responsibility Area?
What's the official CAL FIRE hazard rating?
layers.dataSource: California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection
layers.notes: SRA covers rural/wildland areas. Query both SRA and LRA layers for complete coverage.

layers.name: CAL FIRE FHSZ - Local Responsibility Area
layers.description: Fire Hazard Severity Zones in Local Responsibility Areas (cities and urbanized areas where local fire departments have primary responsibility).
userQuestions: What's the fire hazard in this urban area?
Is this in a Local Responsibility Area?
layers.dataSource: California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection
layers.notes: LRA covers cities and urban areas.

layers.name: Alquist-Priolo Earthquake Fault Zones
layers.description: California Geological Survey Alquist-Priolo Earthquake Fault Zones. Properties in these zones require geologic studies before development.
userQuestions: Is this property on a fault line?
Do I need a geologic study to build here?
What's the earthquake risk?
layers.dataSource: California Geological Survey
layers.notes: Structures for human occupancy within these zones require geologic investigation. California Albers projection (EPSG:3310).

layers.name: Seismic Hazard Zones - Liquefaction
layers.description: Areas where historic occurrence of liquefaction or local geological conditions indicate potential for permanent ground displacements during earthquakes.
userQuestions: Is this area at risk of liquefaction?
Could the ground fail here during an earthquake?
layers.dataSource: California Geological Survey

layers.name: Garbage Service Areas
layers.description: Garbage and recycling service provider boundaries in Solano County.
userQuestions: Who picks up my trash?
What's my garbage service provider?
Who do I call about recycling?

layers.name: Water Districts
layers.description: Water district boundaries in Solano County.
userQuestions: Who provides my water?
What water district am I in?

layers.name: Fire Response Boundaries
layers.description: Fire department/district response area boundaries.
userQuestions: Which fire department serves my area?
What fire district am I in?

layers.name: Public Transit Stops

layers.name: Community Centers
layers.description: Community center locations in Solano County.

layers.description: Real-time road closure information in Solano County.

layers.notes: Real-time data updated as closures occur.

layers.name: Road Restrictions (Points)

Can a truck pass through here?

layers.name: Bridges
layers.description: Bridge locations and conditions in Solano County.

layers.description: Active flooding incidents reported through Office of Emergency Services.

layers.name: OES Downed Power Lines
layers.description: Active downed power line incidents reported through Office of Emergency Services.

layers.name: OES Downed Trees

layers.description: ADU-eligible areas in unincorporated Solano County.

Show me the current aerial photo
layers.notes: Use this for detailed property views instead of generic world imagery. Web Mercator projection.

layers.name: USFWS Critical Habitat Areas
layers.description: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service critical habitat polygons for federally listed species. Important for environmental review and CEQA/NEPA compliance.
userQuestions: Is this property in critical habitat?
Are there endangered species concerns here?
What species habitat is protected here?
layers.notes: Source: California Open Data Portal. Important for development projects requiring environmental review.

layers.name: Suisun Marsh Protection Plan Areas
layers.description: Primary and Secondary Management Areas of the Suisun Marsh as defined by BCDC's Suisun Marsh Protection Plan.
userQuestions: Is this property in the Suisun Marsh?
What marsh management area is this in?
Is BCDC jurisdiction involved here?
layers.notes: For cartographic purposes only - not for jurisdictional determinations. Contact BCDC for official boundaries.

layers.name: Groundwater Basins
layers.description: DWR Bulletin 118 groundwater basin boundaries. Important for SGMA compliance and well permits.
userQuestions: What groundwater basin is this property in?
Is this in a SGMA basin?
What aquifer underlies this area?
layers.notes: Basins include Napa-Sonoma Valley, Sacramento Valley, and Suisun-Fairfield Valley.

layers.name: Protected Areas (CPAD)
layers.description: California Protected Areas Database - lands owned by government and nonprofits protected for open space purposes.
userQuestions: Is this protected open space?
Who owns this conservation land?
Is this property publicly accessible?

fields.name: access_typ
fields.description: Public access level (Open, Restricted, No Public, Unknown)

layers.notes: Data from January 2024 CPAD release. Boundaries typically aligned to assessor parcel lines.

layers.name: Bird Strike Hazard Zone
layers.description: Wildlife hazard zone around Travis Air Force Base - 14,500-foot radius from runway centerlines with development restrictions.
userQuestions: Is this property in the Travis AFB bird strike zone?
Are there airport-related development restrictions here?
layers.notes: Developments attracting hazardous wildlife are restricted. Consult Resource Management for requirements.

layers.name: PLSS Sections
layers.description: Public Land Survey System section boundaries. Used for legal descriptions and land surveys.
userQuestions: What section/township/range is this property in?
What's the PLSS description for this location?
layers.notes: Combines BLM data with additions for Ranchos and offshore areas.

layers.name: Voting Precincts
layers.description: Current election precinct boundaries. Updated January 2025.
userQuestions: What voting precinct is this address in?
What precinct do I vote in?
layers.notes: Updated as of January 2025. Contact Registrar of Voters for polling place information.

layers.name: California State Responsibility Area
layers.description: State Responsibility Area (SRA) boundaries where CAL FIRE has primary firefighting responsibility.
userQuestions: Is this in a State Responsibility Area?
Does CAL FIRE protect this area?

layers.name: Benicia Flood Hazard Areas
layers.description: City of Benicia flood hazard areas derived from FEMA DFIRM data. Includes flood zones, base flood elevations, and zone subtypes specific to Benicia.
userQuestions: What's the flood zone in Benicia?
Is this Benicia property in a flood hazard area?
What's the base flood elevation here?

fields.name: FLD_ZONE
fields.description: FEMA flood zone designation (A, AE, X, etc.)

layers.notes: Specific to Benicia city limits. For countywide flood zones use FEMA NFHL layer.

layers.name: Benicia EV Charging Stations
layers.description: Electric vehicle charging station locations in Benicia including availability, connector types, power output, and network information.
userQuestions: Where can I charge my EV in Benicia?
Are there electric vehicle charging stations nearby?
What charging networks are available in Benicia?

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Type of charging station (Level 2, DC Fast, etc.)

layers.notes: Benicia city only. Check ChargePoint or PlugShare for real-time availability.

layers.name: Vallejo Pavement Condition Index
layers.description: Pavement Condition Index (PCI) ratings for streets in Vallejo. Shows road condition from 0-100, surface type, and last assessment date. Useful for understanding road maintenance priorities.
userQuestions: What's the road condition in Vallejo?
What's the pavement rating for this street?
Which Vallejo streets need repair?

fields.name: PCICONDITI
fields.description: Condition category (Excellent, Good, Fair, Poor, Failed)

layers.notes: Vallejo city only. PCI scale: 0-25 Failed, 25-50 Poor, 50-70 Fair, 70-85 Good, 85-100 Excellent.

layers.name: Vallejo Bike Network
layers.description: Bicycle infrastructure in Vallejo including existing bike lanes, planned routes, regional trails, and recommended bicycle corridors.
userQuestions: Where are the bike lanes in Vallejo?
Is there a bike path near this location?
What's the bike route from here to there in Vallejo?
layers.notes: Vallejo city only. Includes both existing infrastructure and planned improvements.

layers.name: Caltrans Traffic Volumes (AADT)
layers.description: Annual Average Daily Traffic counts at locations throughout California's state highway system. Shows traffic volume patterns for transportation planning.
userQuestions: What's the traffic volume on this highway?
How busy is this road?
What's the AADT for this location?
layers.notes: Statewide coverage. AADT = total yearly volume / 365, adjusted for seasonal variations.

layers.name: California Rest Areas
layers.description: Safety Roadside Rest Areas along California state highways. Includes amenities like restrooms, water, picnic tables, RV stations, and pet areas.
userQuestions: Where's the nearest rest area?
Are there rest stops on I-80?
Does this rest area have an RV dump station?
layers.notes: Statewide coverage. Useful for trip planning on state highways.

layers.name: California State Highway Bridges
layers.description: State highway bridges managed by Caltrans. Includes bridge name, year built, length, and material. Over 13,000 bridges statewide.
userQuestions: What bridges are in Solano County?
When was this bridge built?
What's the Carquinez Bridge information?
layers.notes: Statewide coverage. Data from Caltrans Structure Maintenance and Investigations.

layers.name: Road Centerlines
layers.description: Road centerline feature class for Solano County, actively updated monthly. Follows CalOES schema with additional county-specific fields. Includes street names, road classification, speed limits, one-way designations, and address ranges.
userQuestions: What road is this?
What's the speed limit on this road?
What streets are in this area?
Is this road one-way?
Who maintains this road?

fields.name: oneway
fields.description: One-way designation (FT, TF, or blank for two-way)

layers.notes: Data maintained by Geographic Technologies Group (GTG). CalOES schema compliant.

layers.name: California 100-Year Floodplains (DWR)
layers.description: State-level 100-year floodplain mapping from Department of Water Resources. Best available flood hazard information per Senate Bill 5. Complements FEMA data.
userQuestions: Is this in a state-designated floodplain?
What's the DWR flood risk here?
Is this property in the 100-year flood zone?
layers.notes: Covers Sacramento and San Joaquin River Basins. Use with FEMA NFHL for complete picture.

layers.name: California 200-Year Floodplains (DWR)
layers.description: State-level 200-year floodplain mapping (0.5% annual chance) from Department of Water Resources.
userQuestions: Is this in a 200-year floodplain?
What's the extended flood risk here?
layers.notes: Covers Sacramento and San Joaquin River Basins. 0.5% annual chance flood.

layers.name: California Oil and Gas Wells
layers.description: All oil and gas wells in California from the CalGEM WellSTAR database. Includes well type, status, operator, and location. Updated nightly.
userQuestions: Are there any oil or gas wells near this property?
What's the status of nearby wells?
Who operates the wells in this area?
layers.notes: Statewide coverage from CalGEM WellSTAR. Important for property research near historic oil fields.

layers.name: California Geothermal Wells
layers.description: Geothermal wells in California from the CalGEM WellSTAR database.
userQuestions: Are there geothermal wells in this area?
Where are geothermal resources in Solano County?
layers.notes: Limited geothermal activity in Solano County, but included for completeness.

layers.name: Subdivisions
layers.description: Recorded subdivision boundaries in Solano County. Shows subdivision names and phases for property research and development history.
userQuestions: What subdivision is this property in?
What's the name of this development?
What phase is this lot in?

layers.name: Census Blocks (2020)
layers.description: 2020 Census block boundaries with population and housing unit counts. Most granular census geography for detailed demographic analysis.
userQuestions: What's the population of this block?
How many housing units are in this area?
What's the census block ID for this location?

layers.name: City Sphere of Influence
layers.description: LAFCO-approved Sphere of Influence boundaries for incorporated cities in Solano County. Defines probable future service areas and urban growth boundaries.
userQuestions: Is this property in a city's sphere of influence?
Which city's SOI is this in?
Is this area planned for annexation?

fields.name: sphere
fields.description: City name for sphere of influence

layers.notes: Updated by LAFCO. Key for understanding potential future annexation and service extensions.

layers.name: Greenbelts
layers.description: Agricultural and open space greenbelts surrounding urban areas. Includes Vacaville-Dixon, Davis-Dixon, and Vacaville-Fairfield-Solano greenbelts. Managed by local jurisdictions and land trusts.
userQuestions: Is this property in a greenbelt?
What greenbelt protections apply here?
Where are the urban growth boundaries?

layers.name: Streams and Waterways (NHD)
layers.description: National Hydrography Dataset line features including rivers, streams, canals, and ditches in Solano County. 1:24,000 scale from USGS.
userQuestions: What stream is near this property?
Is there a creek on this parcel?
What waterways are in this area?

layers.name: Water Bodies (NHD)
layers.description: National Hydrography Dataset polygon features including lakes, ponds, reservoirs, and marshes in Solano County. 1:24,000 scale from USGS.

Is this property near a reservoir?

layers.name: Community College Districts
layers.description: Community college district boundaries in Solano County. Shows the 7 community college districts serving county residents.
userQuestions: What community college district is this in?
Which community college serves this area?

How close is this to Travis AFB?

layers.name: Mobile Home Parks

How many units are in this mobile home park?

layers.name: Senior Centers

layers.name: Government Buildings
layers.description: Government building locations in Solano County including county offices, city halls, and other civic facilities.

Where is city hall?

layers.name: Courthouses
layers.description: Courthouse locations in Solano County including Superior Court facilities.

What courts are in this city?

layers.name: Electrical Substations
layers.description: Electrical substation locations in Solano County. Includes owner, voltage, and type information.

What utility infrastructure is in this area?

layers.name: PLSS Township and Range
layers.description: Public Land Survey System township and range grid. Used for legal land descriptions in property documents.

layers.name: Drinking Water System Boundaries
layers.description: Service area boundaries for drinking water providers as verified by the State Water Resources Control Board Division of Drinking Water.
userQuestions: What water system serves this property?
Who provides drinking water here?
What's the water service area for this location?

layers.name: Polling Places
layers.description: Voting polling place locations in Solano County. Updated for each election cycle by the Registrar of Voters.
userQuestions: Where is my polling place?
Where can I vote in this area?
layers.notes: Locations may change each election. Contact Registrar of Voters for current information.

layers.name: Solano County LiDAR (2023)
layers.description: Quality Level 1 LiDAR elevation data for Solano County, collected in 2023 in partnership with USGS 3D Elevation Program (3DEP). Includes point cloud data (LAZ), digital elevation models (DEM), and intensity images.
userQuestions: Where can I download LiDAR data for Solano County?
Is there elevation data available?
Where can I get terrain/topographic data?
layers.notes: QL1 LiDAR with 8 pulses per square meter. Data hosted by USGS via The National Map. Multiple tile formats available including LAZ point clouds and derived DEMs.

downloads.notes: USGS data portal with LAZ point cloud tiles, DEMs, and metadata. Navigate to select individual tiles or download bulk data.

layers.name: ACS Population by Race and Hispanic Origin
layers.description: Population broken down by race and Hispanic origin from the American Community Survey 5-year estimates. Includes total population, racial breakdowns, and Hispanic/Latino percentages.
userQuestions: What is the population of this area?
What is the racial breakdown?
What percentage is Hispanic or Latino?
How diverse is this community?
layers.dataSource: US Census Bureau American Community Survey
layers.notes: Auto-updates annually when Census releases new 5-year estimates. County-level data (layer 1). Use layer 2 for tract-level detail.

layers.name: ACS Median Household Income
layers.description: Median household income by race and age of householder from American Community Survey 5-year estimates.
userQuestions: What is the median household income?
How much do people earn here?
What is the income level in this area?
layers.dataSource: US Census Bureau American Community Survey

layers.name: ACS Poverty Status by Age
layers.description: Poverty status by age group from American Community Survey 5-year estimates. Shows population below poverty level.
userQuestions: What is the poverty rate?
How many people are below the poverty line?
What percentage live in poverty?

fields.name: B17020_001E
fields.description: Population for whom poverty status is determined

layers.dataSource: US Census Bureau American Community Survey

layers.name: ACS Housing Costs
layers.description: Housing costs including median rent, median home value, and cost burden from American Community Survey 5-year estimates.
userQuestions: What is the median rent?
What is the median home value?
How affordable is housing here?
What are housing costs?
layers.dataSource: US Census Bureau American Community Survey

layers.name: ACS Employment Status
layers.description: Employment status and labor force participation from American Community Survey 5-year estimates.
userQuestions: What is the unemployment rate?
How many people are employed?
What is the labor force participation?

fields.name: B23020_001E
fields.description: Mean usual hours worked per week

layers.dataSource: US Census Bureau American Community Survey

layers.name: ACS Educational Attainment
layers.description: Educational attainment levels for population 25 years and over from American Community Survey 5-year estimates.
userQuestions: What is the education level?
What percentage have a college degree?
How many have a high school diploma?
What is the educational attainment?

fields.name: B15003_calc_pctHSE
fields.description: Percent with high school diploma or higher

fields.name: B15003_calc_pctBachE
fields.description: Percent with bachelor's degree or higher

fields.name: B15003_calc_pctGradProfE
fields.description: Percent with graduate or professional degree

layers.dataSource: US Census Bureau American Community Survey

layers.name: ACS Internet Connectivity
layers.description: Internet access and broadband connectivity from American Community Survey 5-year estimates.
userQuestions: What percentage have internet access?
How many have broadband?
Is there a digital divide here?
What is the internet connectivity?
layers.dataSource: US Census Bureau American Community Survey

layers.name: ACS Transportation to Work
layers.description: Means of transportation to work from American Community Survey 5-year estimates. Includes commute mode breakdown.
userQuestions: How do people commute?
What percentage drive to work?
How many use public transit?
What is the commute mode?
layers.dataSource: US Census Bureau American Community Survey

layers.name: ACS Disability Status
layers.description: Disability status by age and sex from American Community Survey 5-year estimates.
userQuestions: What is the disability rate?
How many people have disabilities?
What percentage have a disability?
layers.dataSource: US Census Bureau American Community Survey

layers.name: ACS Health Insurance Coverage
layers.description: Health insurance coverage status from American Community Survey 5-year estimates.
userQuestions: What percentage have health insurance?
How many are uninsured?
What is the health insurance coverage?
layers.dataSource: US Census Bureau American Community Survey

layers.name: ACS Veteran Status
layers.description: Veteran population by sex and age from American Community Survey 5-year estimates.
userQuestions: How many veterans live here?
What is the veteran population?
What percentage are veterans?
layers.dataSource: US Census Bureau American Community Survey

layers.name: ACS Context for Senior Well-Being
layers.description: Key indicators relevant to senior populations including age 65+, living alone, poverty, disability, and health insurance status.
userQuestions: How many seniors live here?
What is the senior population?
What services do seniors need?
How many elderly live alone?
layers.dataSource: US Census Bureau American Community Survey

layers.name: ACS Context for Emergency Response
layers.description: Key vulnerability indicators for emergency planning including age groups, disability status, language barriers, and vehicle access.
userQuestions: What are the vulnerable populations?
Who needs help in an emergency?
What is the vulnerability profile?
How many lack vehicle access?
layers.dataSource: US Census Bureau American Community Survey
layers.notes: Useful for emergency planning and identifying populations that may need assistance during disasters.
